title: Intentions for the Week
description: Intentions for the Week- Week 14 in 2025 Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 14! How was your weekend? Did you have any time to yourself? (I did) Did you get to rest? (I tried!) Did you do meal prep? (I did) Do you know what’s for dinner tonight? (I’m having soup!) Here’s what I meal prepped this week: Meal prepped this week: Coconut Curry Soup celery + ranch dip veggie cream cheese mom’s vinaigrette steel-cut oats with raisins meaty marinara penne pasta chocolate chia pudding burgers rice Here are my Intentions for the Week: Intentions this Week This week’s intentions: Mind/Body morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracy’s tracking tools favorite pens process march- currently edit video of March spread post march on youtube post recipe organize tax stuff figure out next binder class SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. Box Home grocery shop organize my office paper piles laundry plant things litterboxes water indoor plants go through pantry compost/worm bin clean kitchen clear off stairs clear off dining room table vac stairs clean out car straighten up garage refill pill case garbage/recycling Last Week’s Intentions: Mind/Body follow up with doc morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracy’s tracking tools favorite pens prep for zoom this weekend make March spread edit video of March spread post march on youtube post recipe organize tax stuff figure out next binder class SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. Box Home grocery shop organize my office paper piles laundry get more dirt/mulch plant things litterboxes water indoor plants go through pantry compost/worm bin clean kitchen clear off stairs clear off dining room table vac stairs clean out car straighten up garage refill pill case garbage/recycling Posts to Inspire: Turmeric Latte Butter Braised Carrots Spicy Pickled Carrots Carrot Ginger Bread Roast Carrots with Chile Yogurt & Cilantro Sauce Simple Caesar Salad If you make a recipe from Shutterbean, tag me on Instagram! I’d love to see your creations! Here’s a mood: Mantra for the week! Feeling stuck? Make a list! Write down your intentions for the week to help hold you accountable for action. My Intentions for the Week Calendar can help!! You can start it at any time of the year! I also have a printable if you work well with a one-sheet. Here it is in a binder. It’s part of my Time Management Printable pack! Need extra help? Join my accountability group: SELF-CHECK-IN We spend Sunday mornings 9:00 AM PST-10:30 AM- PST working on our calendars and checking in together. Those are my Intentions for the Week! Wishing you a productive week. Take good care of YOU! The post Intentions for the Week appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Intentions for the Week is a weekly TO DO list series on Shutterbean.com, created by Tracy Benjamin of The Handwriting Club. What started as a personal planning ritual turned into a structured planner designed to help you organize your week with intention, creativity, and accountability. Follow along every Monday for inspiration, productivity tips, and a space to map out your goals!

Take good care of YOU!
html:
Intentions for the Week- Week 14 in 2025

Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 14!  How was your weekend? 

Did you have any time to yourself? (I did)

Did you get to rest?  (I tried!) 

Did you do meal prep? (I did)

Do you know what’s for dinner tonight? (I’m having soup!)

Here’s what I meal prepped this week:

Meal prepped this week:

  • Coconut Curry Soup
  • celery + ranch dip
  • veggie cream cheese
  • mom’s vinaigrette
  • steel-cut oats with raisins
  • meaty marinara 
  • penne pasta 
  • chocolate chia pudding
  • burgers
  • rice

Here are my Intentions for the Week: 

Intentions this Week 

This week’s intentions: 

Mind/Body

  • morning pages/ morning routine
  • 30 minutes no screen after wakeup
  • fill out my Intentions for the week calendar
  • keep track of what I eat in my food journal
  • keep track of movement on Apple watch
  • move body daily- break a sweat
  • breath work
  • work in Currently workbook
  • check-in with calendar 
  • art time
  • floss daily
  • horoscope
  • connect with my spirit 
  • work in my hobonichi cousin
  • outdoor time/hike?
  • pull cards/journal/video
  • watch how much time I spend on the phone
  • tweeze things
  • paint nails
  • do a hair treatment
  • clean house + phone a friend
  • use my diffuser
  • eating meeting
  • steam facial
  • take vitamins 
  • stay hydrated 
  • read before bed
  • quality time with my cats
  • get enough sleep

Work:

  • intentions for the week 
  • i love lists 
  • record stuff
  • my everyday life
  • tracy’s tracking tools 
  • favorite pens
  • process march- currently
  • edit video of March spread 
  • post march on youtube
  • post recipe
  • organize tax stuff
  • figure out next binder class
  • SELF Check In! 
  • upload/edit photos
  • recipe testing
  • work on Currently Workbook 
  • work on THC
  • clean up office
  • package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club  (THANK YOU!)
  • catch up pinning on my Pinterest account
  • Tailwind
  • catch up on social media
  • clean up workspace 
  • bookkeeping/pay bills
  • emails 
  • go to P.O. Box

  • grocery shop
  • organize my office
  • paper piles 
  • laundry 
  • plant things
  • litterboxes
  • water indoor plants 
  • go through pantry 
  • compost/worm bin
  • clean kitchen
  • clear off stairs

  • straighten up garage 
  • refill pill case

Posts to Inspire:

Turmeric Latte 

Butter Braised Carrots

Spicy Pickled Carrots 

Carrot Ginger Bread 

Roast Carrots with Chile Yogurt & Cilantro Sauce

Simple Caesar Salad 

If you make a recipe from Shutterbean, tag me on Instagram! I’d love to see your creations! 

Here’s a mood: 

Mantra for the week!

Feeling stuck? Make a list! Write down your intentions for the week to help hold you accountable for action. 

My Intentions for the Week Calendar can help!!   You can start it at any time of the year!

I also have a printable if you work well with a one-sheet. Here it is in a binder. 

It’s part of my Time Management Printable pack! 

Need extra help? Join my accountability group:

SELF-CHECK-IN

We spend Sunday mornings 9:00 AM PST-10:30 AM- PST working on our calendars and checking in together. 

Those are my Intentions for the Week! 

Wishing you a productive week. Take good care of YOU!
